Index.title: Explore Molecular Docking against Plasmodium with Plasmodocking
Index.description: An easy and fast way to implement a molecular docking experiment using AutoDockGPU, optimized to speed up the docking process against multiple targets.
Index.advantages_description: AutoDockGPU offers a significant increase in the calculation speed of molecular docking, allowing faster analyses and virtual screening of thousands of compounds, ideal for large-scale studies.
Index.techniques_description: Using advanced search and optimization techniques, such as genetic algorithms and gradient-based local search, AutoDockGPU maximizes efficiency in identifying high-affinity ligand-protein configurations.
Index.project_description: Plasmodocking is a revolution in malaria research, facilitating advanced molecular docking studies to develop potential new drugs against the most dangerous forms of the disease caused by Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax.
Index.advances_description: The Plasmodocking platform enhances the potential for identifying new drugs, offering an innovative approach to experimentation with molecular docking.
Index.molecular_interactions_description: Plasmodocking provides an accelerated, detailed analysis of the interactions between ligands and molecular targets, offering a more comprehensive and efficient analysis of results.
Index.virtual_screening_description: The platform conducts virtual screening, exploring molecular interactions for the agile and effective identification of compounds with anti-malarial potential.
Index.drug_candidates_description: Plasmodocking rigorously evaluates each ligand, using an extensive library of compounds to identify the most promising interactions against Plasmodium.
Index.target_preparation_title: Selection and Preparation of Target Macromolecules
Index.target_preparation_description: Plasmodocking features a database of pre-selected, prepared, and standardized target macromolecules. These macromolecules are known enzymes of Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax. They are used in the docking processes against each submitted ligand, facilitating the Virtual Screening process based on the type of Plasmodium selected by the user.
Index.target_standardization_description: Each selected target has undergone a standardization process, where redocking was applied for validation. This process included receptor preparation, setting coordinate parameters, and gridbox size, replicating the original position of the crystallized ligand. 'Ligand types' maps were generated, and final docking tests were performed to save the information for subsequent processes.
Index.validated_ligands: Listing of Macromolecules Validated with Redocking of Crystallized Ligands
Index.non_validated_ligands: Listing of Macromolecules Without Redocking Validation

About.efficiency_innovation: Efficiency and Innovation in Molecular Docking
About.project_description: The Plasmodocking project is an initiative that combines the power of Django and Next.js with the efficiency of AutodockGPU to accelerate molecular docking processes using GPUs. We hope to contribute to drug development research by offering a robust and agile tool for scientists and researchers in the field. Simply provide the candidate inhibitor molecules and wait for the docking results against all available enzymes of Plasmodium falciparum. We hope this accelerates your research! Soon we will also bring targets of Plasmodium vivax!

members.name: Dr. Fernando Berton Zanchi
members.title: Coordinator
members.desc: Researcher in Bioinformatics at Fiocruz. Working against tropical diseases since 2009. Recently focusing on developing tools to facilitate the use of Bioinformatics.
